en: Who is your favorite player?
zh: 你最喜欢的球员是谁？

en: Who's your favorite player?
zh: 你最喜欢哪个球员？

en: You may bring whomever you like.
zh: 你想带谁就带谁。

en: You may bring whoever you like.
zh: 你想带谁都行。

en: Give it to whomever you like.
zh: 你想给谁就给谁。

en: Eat whatever food you like.
zh: 喜欢吃什么就吃什么。

en: Choose any flowers you like.
zh: 随便挑你喜欢的花。

en: Who is your favorite singer?
zh: 你最喜欢的歌手是谁？

en: Who's your favorite singer?
zh: 你最喜欢哪个歌手？

en: You can travel how you please.
zh: 你想怎么旅游就怎么旅游。

en: You may dance as you please.
zh: 你想怎么跳就怎么跳。

en: You may play at your pleasure.
zh: 你想怎么玩就怎么玩。

en: You may come and go at will.
zh: 你可以随心所欲地来回。

en: You may choose what you like.
zh: 喜欢哪个就选哪个。

en: Point your finger at your choice.
zh: 指一下你选的那个。

en: Which brand do you prefer?
zh: 你更喜欢哪个牌子？

en: Buy any dress you like.
zh: 喜欢哪件裙子就买哪件。

en: Choose any dress you like.
zh: 随便挑你喜欢的裙子。

en: You can go anyplace you like.
zh: 你想去哪儿就去哪儿。

en: Put it where you like.
zh: 你想放哪儿就放哪儿。

en: You may come whenever you like.
zh: 你想什么时候来都行。

en: You can call me any time.
zh: 你随时可以给我打电话。

en: You may talk as much as you like.
zh: 你想聊多久就聊多久。

en: Take as many peaches as you like.
zh: 桃子想拿多少拿多少。

en: Take as many peaches as you want.
zh: 桃子想要多少拿多少。

en: You may stay at my house as long as you like.
zh: 在我家你想住多久都行。

en: You can stay as long as you like.
zh: 你想待多久就待多久。

en: You can eat and drink as much as you want.
zh: 你可以尽情吃喝。

en: Cut and come again.
zh: 多吃点，别客气。

en: What's your favorite sport?
zh: 你最喜欢什么运动？

en: Time passes quickly when we are doing something we like.
zh: 做喜欢的事时，时间过得特别快。

en: You can do whatever you like.
zh: 你想做什么就做什么。

en: The pleasure is mine.
zh: 这是我的荣幸。

en: Whether you like it or not, you have to do your homework.
zh: 不管你喜不喜欢，你都得做作业。

en: Whether you like it or not, you must stick to your work.
zh: 不管你愿不愿意，你都得坚持工作。

en: Whether you like it or not, you'll have to do it.
zh: 不管你喜不喜欢，你都得做。

en: Like it or not, you have to do it.
zh: 喜不喜欢你都得做。

en: Whether you like it or not, you must do it at once.
zh: 不管你愿不愿意，你得马上做。

en: Like it or not, you have to do that right away.
zh: 喜不喜欢你都得马上办。

en: You must take this medicine, whether you like it or not.
zh: 不管你喜不喜欢，你都得吃这药。

en: Like it or not, you have to take this medicine.
zh: 喜不喜欢你都得把这药吃了。

en: I have a sore throat and runny nose.
zh: 我嗓子疼，还流鼻涕。

en: My throat hurts, and I have a fever. Can I have some cold medicine?
zh: 我嗓子疼，还有点发烧。能给我点感冒药吗？

en: I have a sore throat.
zh: 我嗓子疼。

en: My throat hurts.
zh: 我喉咙痛。

en: Feel free to get yourself a drink if you are thirsty.
zh: 渴了的话就随便喝点什么。

en: I am thirsty. Please give me something cold to drink.
zh: 我渴了，请给我点冰的喝。

en: I'm thirsty. Please give me a cold drink.
zh: 我渴了。请给我一杯冷饮。

en: Aren't you thirsty?
zh: 你不渴吗？

en: Reckless driving will lead to an accident.
zh: 鲁莽驾驶会出事故。

en: He had his license taken away because of reckless driving.
zh: 他因为危险驾驶被吊销了驾照。

en: In daredevil car races, there are moments when the drivers place themselves between the devil and the deep blue sea, trying to take the lead.
zh: 在玩命的赛车比赛中，车手们为了领先，有时会陷入进退两难的境地。

en: The man walking over there is our teacher.
zh: 走在那边的那个男人是我们的老师。

en: The man running over there is my uncle.
zh: 在那边跑着的那个男人是我叔叔。

en: Look at the boy and the dog that are running over there.
zh: 看那边跑着的那个男孩和那条狗。

en: Get away!
zh: 离远点！

en: Go away.
zh: 走开。

en: Go away!
zh: 走开！

en: Go over there.
zh: 去那边。

en: Drop me a line as soon as you get there.
zh: 你一到那儿就给我发个消息。

en: Let's swim over there.
zh: 我们游到那边去吧。

en: Look at the large building over there.
zh: 看那边那栋大楼。

en: You will play into their hands.
zh: 你会中他们的计的。

en: Ask at the police station over there.
zh: 去那边的警察局问问。

en: The man who is standing over there is my father.
zh: 站在那边的那个男人是我爸。

en: Who is the girl standing over there?
zh: 站在那边的那个女孩是谁？

en: Who's the girl standing over there?
zh: 那边站着的那个女孩是谁？

en: The girl standing over there is my sister Sue.
zh: 站在那边的那个女孩是我妹妹苏。

en: You can see a white tower over there.
zh: 你能看到那边有一座白塔。

en: The mountain whose top you can see over there is Mt. Fuji.
zh: 那边能看到山顶的那座山是富士山。

en: Let me know it as soon as you get there.
zh: 你一到那儿就跟我说一声。

en: Drop me a line when you get there.
zh: 你到了那儿给我发个信儿。

en: Send me a letter when you arrive.
zh: 你到了之后给我寄封信。

en: I want you to write to me as soon as you get there.
zh: 我想让你一到那儿就给我写信。

en: Can you see Mt. Daisetsu over there?
zh: 你能看到那边的大雪山吗？

en: We can see a big mountain over there.
zh: 我们可以看到那边有一座大山。

en: We saw a small island beyond.
zh: 我们看到远处有一个小岛。

en: The woman sitting over there is his present wife.
zh: 坐在那边的那个女人是他现在的妻子。

en: The lady whom you see over there is a famous violinist.
zh: 那边那位女士是一位著名的小提琴家。

en: The man you see over there is a famous writer.
zh: 你在那边看到的那个男人是一位著名的作家。

en: The man whom you see over there is my uncle.
zh: 你在那边看到的那个男人是我叔叔。

en: That tower you see over there is the Eiffel Tower.
zh: 你在那边看到的那座塔是埃菲尔铁塔。

en: Do you see any policeman over there?
zh: 你看到那边有警察吗？

en: Can you see anything over there?
zh: 你在那边能看到什么吗？

en: The house whose roof you can see over there is ours.
zh: 那边能看到屋顶的那栋房子是我们的。

en: The house whose roof you see over there is my father's.
zh: 那边能看到屋顶的那栋房子是我父亲的。

en: Don't fail to call me as soon as you arrive there.
zh: 你一到那儿一定要记得给我打电话。

en: I wonder who the man over there may be.
zh: 我在想那边那个人是谁。

en: The boy over there is his brother.
zh: 那边的那个男孩是他兄弟。

en: Are you knowing the girl who is over there?
zh: 你认识那边的那个女孩吗？

en: Who in the world is the fellow over there?
zh: 那边的那个家伙到底是谁啊？

en: That gentleman over there is well spoken of.
zh: 那位绅士的口碑很好。

en: Look at that koala over there.
zh: 看那边那只考拉。

en: The girl sitting over there is Nancy.
zh: 坐在那边的那个女孩是南希。

en: The tall guy smoking a cigar over there is a famous director.
zh: 那边那个抽雪茄的高个子是位著名的导演。

en: The man reading a book over there is my father.
zh: 那边那个看书的男人是我爸爸。

en: The girl running over there is my sister.
zh: 那边跑着的那个女孩是我妹妹。

en: Do you know the girl waving at us over there?
zh: 你认识那边向我们招手的那个女孩吗？

en: I would like to take a seat over there.
zh: 我想坐到那边去。

en: Can you help her out before they get her?
zh: 你能在他们抓到她之前帮帮她吗？

en: Can you help her out before they catch her?
zh: 在他们抓到她之前，你能不能帮她一把？

en: The wind blew against the sail.
zh: 风吹在帆上。

en: The headwind blew against the sail.
zh: 逆风吹着船帆。

en: Please stand face to face.
zh: 请面对面站着。

en: Will you go across to the baker's and buy some bread?
zh: 你能去对面面包店买点面包吗？

en: They argue a lot, but for the most part they get along quite well together.
zh: 他们老是吵架，但总的来说相处得还挺好的。

en: The quarrel ended in their coming to blows.
zh: 吵到最后，他们竟然动手打起来了。

en: The quarrel settled, he returned home.
zh: 架吵完后，他就回家了。

en: Sometimes it is hard to tell how a quarrel comes about.
zh: 有时候很难说清楚架是怎么吵起来的。

en: Just as the argument got heated he interposed.
zh: 就在争吵最激烈的时候，他插进话来。

en: Is it true? Paul kissed Lily on the lips?
zh: 是真的吗？保罗亲了莉莉的嘴唇？

en: A mustache grows on the upper lip.
zh: 胡子长在上嘴唇上。

en: I have ulcers in my mouth, so it's very painful when I eat.
zh: 我嘴里长溃疡了，吃东西特别疼。

en: I have a ulcer in my mouth.
zh: 我嘴里起了个溃疡。

en: My father beat me answering him back.
zh: 我因为顶嘴被我爸打了。

en: Please put in this way.
zh: 请这样放。

en: A whistle involves blowing out of your mouth in a certain way.
zh: 吹口哨就是让气流以特定的方式从嘴里吹出来。

en: People are likely to be deceived by a smooth talker.
zh: 人很容易被那些花言巧语的人给骗了。

en: Don't pay lip service to me.
zh: 别跟我耍嘴皮子。

en: We need less talk and more action.
zh: 我们要少说废话，多干实事。

en: "You talk too much," he said.
zh: “你话太多了，”他说。

en: You talk too much.
zh: 你话太多了。

en: Least said, soonest mended.
zh: 话越少，麻烦越少。

en: Few words show men wise.
zh: 智者寡言。

en: I have bad breath.
zh: 我有口臭。

en: Here's my account number.
zh: 这是我的账号。

en: I want to close my account.
zh: 我想注销账户。

en: I'd like to open an account.
zh: 我想开个账户。

en: Colloquial speech is used in everyday conversation.
zh: 日常交流通常都用口语。

en: I expect you can tell from the quoted text, but this is a book written in a colloquial style.
zh: 我想你从引文中也能看出来，这本书是用口语写的。

en: Shut your mouth.
zh: 闭嘴。

en: Close your mouth.
zh: 把嘴闭上。

en: Open your mouth wide.
zh: 嘴张大。

en: You'd better hold your tongue.
zh: 你最好把嘴闭严实点。

en: You keep out of this.
zh: 这事你别插手。

en: Open your mouth and close your eyes.
zh: 张开嘴，闭上眼。

en: Don't speak with your mouth full.
zh: 嘴里有东西的时候别说话。

en: Please rinse out your mouth.
zh: 请漱一下口。

en: I told you again and again.
zh: 我跟你说了一遍又一遍了。

en: I no longer have the energy to talk.
zh: 我累得连话都不想说了。

en: Open your mouth.
zh: 张嘴。

en: Keep your mouth shut and your eyes open.
zh: 多看少说。

en: The mouth is the executioner and the doctor of the body.
zh: 嘴巴既能救人，也能害人。

en: It's better not to prattle on about meaningless things. The more you open your mouth the more likely you are to put your foot in it.
zh: 最好别瞎扯些没用的，说得越多，越容易说错话。

en: Out of the mouth comes evil.
zh: 祸从口出。

en: My mouth was dry.
zh: 我嘴里很干。

en: The tongue wounds more than a lance.
zh: 言语伤人胜过刀枪。

en: You're all talk and no action!
zh: 你就是个光说不练的人！

en: Talk will not avail without work.
zh: 光说不练没用。

en: You must not talk with your mouth full.
zh: 嘴里吃着东西的时候不能说话。

en: Honey in the mouth and poison in the heart.
zh: 口蜜腹剑。

en: Do not talk with your mouth full.
zh: 嘴里有东西时别说话。

en: It's not polite to speak with your mouth full.
zh: 嘴里塞满东西说话很不礼貌。

en: You must not speak with your mouth full.
zh: 嘴里有饭的时候绝对不能说话。

en: Don't talk with your mouth full.
zh: 嘴里含着东西别说话。

en: It is bad manners to speak with your mouth full.
zh: 嘴里塞着东西说话很没教养。

en: When the word is out, it belongs to another.
zh: 话一说出口，就收不回来了。

en: Once the word is out, it belongs to another.
zh: 话一出口，就由不得你了。

en: It is rude to speak with your mouth full.
zh: 嘴里塞满东西说话很失礼。

en: Don't speak with your mouth full!
zh: 嘴里有东西别说话！

en: What we say and what we mean are often quite different.
zh: 我们嘴上说的和心里想的往往是两码事。

en: Keep your purse and your mouth closed.
zh: 管好你的钱包和你的嘴。

en: It is easy to talk.
zh: 说起来倒是容易。

en: Whatever happens, I'll not tell anybody about it.
zh: 不管发生什么，我绝对不会告诉任何人。

en: My tongue slipped.
zh: 我说漏嘴了。

en: It is rude to talk when your mouth is full.
zh: 嘴里有东西的时候说话很不礼貌。

en: Don't talk while you have food in your mouth.
zh: 吃着东西的时候别说话。

en: He's such a shameless jerk.
zh: 他真是个不要脸的混蛋。

en: He had the face to tell me to clear off.
zh: 他竟然有脸叫我滚开。

en: The thick walls baffle outside noises.
zh: 厚墙隔绝了外面的噪音。

en: Efficient machinery replaced manual labor.
zh: 高效的机器取代了体力劳动。

en: In order to bring about an effective agreement of wills, it is not sufficient to study other languages.
zh: 为了达成有效的共识，光学习外语是不够的。

en: The public school system is coming apart at the seams.
zh: 公立学校体系快要崩溃了。

en: My public duties take a lot of time.
zh: 我的公职工作占用了不少时间。

en: Religious education is prohibited at a public school.
zh: 公立学校禁止开展宗教教育。

en: The civil rights movement leads to a dream.
zh: 民权运动承载着一个梦想。

en: He realizes that public officials are human, and that as human beings they are capable of misjudgement.
zh: 他意识到公职人员也是普通人，是人就会有判断错误的时候。

en: To do him justice, he is not idle.
zh: 说句公道话，他并不懒。

en: To do him justice, he is a discreet man.
zh: 公平地说，他是个很谨慎的人。

en: To do him justice, he's done some good work.
zh: 说句公道话，他也干了不少漂亮活。

en: To do him justice, we must admit that his intentions were good.
zh: 说句公道话，我们必须承认他的出发点是好的。

en: To do him justice, he is a reliable man.
zh: 说句公道话，他是个可靠的人。

en: In all fairness, he did do his best.
zh: 公平地说，他确实尽力了。

en: To do him justice, he did his best with his limited men and supplies.
zh: 说句公道话，在人手和物资有限的情况下，他已经尽力了。

en: To do him justice, he is not so lazy.
zh: 说句公道话，他没那么懒。

en: To do him justice, he is not equal to the job.
zh: 说句公道话，他胜任不了这份工作。

en: To do him justice, he is a good-natured man.
zh: 说句公道话，他这人脾气挺好。

en: To do him justice, he is right in his opinion.
zh: 说句公道话，他的观点是对的。

en: To do her justice, we must admit her talent as a writer.
zh: 说句公道话，我们必须承认她的写作天赋。

en: To do him justice, he is not a bad man.
zh: 公平地说，他这人并不坏。

en: To do him justice, he is not without some merits.
zh: 说句公道话，他也还是有些优点的。

en: To do him justice, he is an able man.
zh: 公平地说，他是个有本事的人。

en: To do him justice, he was kind at heart.
zh: 说句公道话，他心肠挺好的。

en: To do him justice, we must say that he is a minor musician.
zh: 说句公道话，他顶多算个二流音乐家。

en: Fair does!
zh: 这才公平嘛！

en: The bank rate cut is expected to relieve the severe financial squeeze that has hit industry.
zh: 银行降息有望缓解工业界遭受的严重资金短缺压力。

en: The corporation invited bids for the construction project.
zh: 公司对这个建设项目发起了招标。

en: Don't swear in public.
zh: 别在公共场合说脏话。

en: Reexamination of the data is required to make the formula accurate.
zh: 为了确保公式准确，需要重新核查数据。

en: To do him justice, he is diligent and kind.
zh: 说句公道话，他既勤奋又善良。

en: Where is a public telephone?
zh: 公用电话在哪儿？

en: There is a public telephone on that corner.
zh: 那边拐角处有个公用电话。

en: He was annoyed at having to show up before the public.
zh: 他挺反感在公众面前露面的。

en: It is not good to ridicule him in public.
zh: 当众嘲笑他不太好。

en: The public convenience should be respected.
zh: 公共利益应当受到尊重。

en: It is sometimes difficult to make yourself understood in public.
zh: 有时候在公共场合很难让别人理解你的意思。

en: You should not confuse business with personal affairs.
zh: 你不该公私不分。

en: We should draw the line between public and private affairs.
zh: 我们应当公私分明。

en: I work for public welfare.
zh: 我从事公益工作。

en: Let's keep public places clean.
zh: 我们要保持公共场所的卫生。

en: Please refrain from smoking in public places.
zh: 在公共场合请勿吸烟。

en: The public transportation system runs like clockwork.
zh: 公交系统运行得非常准时。

en: Emergency exits must be kept free of blockages for public safety.
zh: 为了公共安全，应急出口必须保持通畅。

en: What should we do to protect the beautiful earth from pollution?
zh: 我们该怎么做才能保护地球不受污染？

en: Walking in the park, I found a baby bird.
zh: 在公园散步时，我发现了一只小鸟。

en: Walking in the park, I met a friend of mine.
zh: 在公园散步时，我遇到了一个朋友。

en: What do you say to taking a walk in the park?
zh: 去公园散散步怎么样？

en: Let's take a walk in the park.
zh: 我们去公园走走吧。

en: Taking a walk in the park, I was spoken to by an old couple.
zh: 在公园散步时，一对老夫妇跟我搭了话。

en: I walked across the park.
zh: 我穿过了公园。

en: It is a short drive to the park.
zh: 开车去公园很快就到。

en: It is not easy to find the way to the park.
zh: 去公园的路不太好找。

en: We would rather go to the zoo than to the park.
zh: 我们宁愿去动物园也不想去公园。

en: The park was extended to the river.
zh: 公园一直延伸到了河边。

en: The park was full of people.
zh: 公园里全是人。

en: The park is well wooded.
zh: 公园里树木茂密。

en: The park is filled with children.
zh: 公园里到处都是孩子。

en: Green leaves in a park are pleasing to the eye.
zh: 公园里的绿叶很养眼。

en: Which direction is the park in?
zh: 公园在哪个方向？

en: I walked toward the park.
zh: 我朝公园方向走去。

en: Parks are to the city what lungs are to the animal.
zh: 公园之于城市，就像肺之于动物。

en: There is a pond in the middle of the park.
zh: 公园中间有个池塘。

en: All the cherry trees in the park are in full bloom.
zh: 公园里的樱花全开了。

en: The grass in the park is green and beautiful.
zh: 公园里的草绿油油的，真漂亮。

en: I saw a young man lying on the bench under the cherry tree in the park.

en: Please shut the door.
zh: 麻烦关下门。

en: Please close the door.

en: Close the door please.

en: You'd better shut the door.
zh: 你最好把门关上。

en: I heard a knock at the door.
zh: 我听见有人敲门。

en: I tried to open the door, but I couldn't as it was locked.
zh: 我想开门，但是锁上了打不开。

en: I tried to open the door, but I couldn't because it was locked.
zh: 我试着开门，但门锁着呢，开不开。

en: I tried to open the door, but I couldn't since it was locked.
zh: 我想开门，可门反锁了，没打开。

en: Open the door and let in the dog.
zh: 开下门，把狗放进来。

en: Open the door and let the dog in.
zh: 把门打开，让狗进来。

en: Hold the door.
zh: 帮我扶着点儿门。

en: The door bolts on the inside.

en: The door opens from within.
zh: 门是从里面开的。

en: The door opened by itself.
zh: 门自己开了。

en: Lock the door without fail.
zh: 一定要把门锁好。

en: Lock the door!
zh: 把门锁上！

en: There was a new coat of paint on the door.
zh: 门上刷了层新漆。

en: The door blew open.
zh: 门被风吹开了。

en: The door suddenly opening, she sprang to her feet.
zh: 门突然开了，她一下跳了起来。

en: I heard the door open.
zh: 我听见门开了。

en: To know oneself is not easy.
zh: 了解自己并不容易。

en: Don't judge others by yourself.
zh: 别拿你自己的标准去衡量别人。

en: Nothing is more important than this: to know yourself.
zh: 最重要的莫过于认清你自己。

en: Do unto others as you would have them do unto you.
zh: 你想别人怎么对你，你就怎么对别人。

en: Know who you are.
zh: 认清你自己是谁。

en: Some people enjoy solitude.
zh: 有些人很享受独处。

en: Isolation is the common lot of man.
zh: 孤独是人类的常态。

en: Many times I've been alone.
zh: 很多时候我都是一个人。

en: The lonely patient derives pleasure from sewing.
zh: 那个孤独的病人靠做针线活儿寻找乐趣。

en: We shouldn't confuse solitude with isolation. They are two separate things.
zh: 我们不该把独处和孤立混为一谈，它们是两码事。

en: The orphan children were told to behave themselves.
zh: 那些孤儿们被告知要听话。

en: The fund was set up to help orphans.
zh: 这个基金是为了帮助孤儿而设立的。

en: Being an orphan, my father had to start earning money at ten.
zh: 因为是孤儿，我父亲十岁就开始挣钱了。

en: The orphan met up with his two sisters when he was five years old.
zh: 那个孤儿五岁的时候见到了他的两个姐姐。

en: He put up a brave and lone struggle, but up against such heavy odds he couldn't get his business plan accepted.
zh: 他虽然孤军奋战，但因为阻力太大，他的创业计划还是没通过。

en: Water in a solid state is called ice.
zh: 固态的水叫作冰。

en: When a solid melts, it becomes liquid.
zh: 固体融化后就变成了液体。

en: Leave it in the refrigerator until it sets.
zh: 把它放在冰箱里直到凝固。

en: Don't eat hard foods.
zh: 别吃太硬的东西。

en: I have hard stools.
zh: 我大便很硬。

en: You don't have to be so formal.
zh: 不用这么客气。

en: A man who asks his wife's permission before taking any action except breathing is a henpecked husband.
zh: 除了喘气什么都要请示老婆的男人就是个妻管严。

en: Is he breathing?
zh: 他还有呼吸吗？

en: I have difficulty breathing.
zh: 我呼吸有点困难。

en: I'd like to page someone.
zh: 我想广播找个人。

en: What's the name of the person you want paged?
zh: 你要广播找谁？

en: Can you page someone for me?
zh: 能帮我广播找个人吗？

en: Reading classics is not easy.
zh: 读经典著作可不容易。

en: I like shopping in used-book stores and in used-clothing shops.
zh: 我喜欢逛旧书店和二手衣服店。

en: It is worthwhile reading classical works of literature.
zh: 经典文学作品值得一读。

en: New facts about ancient China have recently come to light.
zh: 最近关于古代中国又有了些新发现。

en: I wish I could see the ancient world.
zh: 我真希望能亲眼看看古代世界。

en: The ancients conceived of the world as flat.
zh: 古代人觉得世界是平的。

en: Some ancient people thought of the sun as their God.
zh: 有些古人把太阳当成神。

en: The ancients believed the earth was flat.
zh: 古人觉得大地是平的。

en: The ancient Romans founded colonies throughout Europe.
zh: 古罗马人在整个欧洲都建立了殖民地。

en: In ancient Rome, the bodyguards who surrounded the wealthy and powerful to protect them when they walked the streets, were called satellites.
zh: 在古罗马，那些在街上保护达官显贵的保镖被称作“satellites”。

en: Ancient astronomers noticed constellations and gave them names.
zh: 古代天文学家注意到了星座，并给它们起了名字。

en: Ancient astronomers did not have instruments to help them see objects in the sky.
zh: 古代天文学家没有那种能帮他们观察天体的仪器。

en: Salt was a rare and costly commodity in ancient times.
zh: 在古代，盐是种既稀有又昂贵的商品。

en: In ancient times, plagues killed many people.
zh: 在古代，瘟疫夺走了很多人的生命。

en: The ancient Greeks knew as much about the solar system as we do.
zh: 古希腊人对太阳系的了解一点儿不比我们少。

en: In the days of the ancient Incas, it was the largest city in America.
zh: 在古印加时期，那是美洲最大的城市。

en: The old guard was nearly voted out of the Upper House.
zh: 那些保守派元老差点就在上议院被投票出局了。

en: He is the bravest soldier that ever lived.
zh: 他是有史以来最勇敢的士兵。

en: No matter where in the world or when, a parent's love for a child is the same.
zh: 无论在何时何地，父母对孩子的爱都是一样的。

en: In all times and places many examples of poor relations between wives and mothers-in-law can be seen.
zh: 无论何时何地，婆媳关系不和的例子都随处可见。

en: He is as brave a man as ever breathed.
zh: 他是我见过最勇敢的人。

en: The good old days are gone never to return.
zh: 那些美好的旧时光一去不复返了。

en: He sent his old clothes home for his brothers, and sent his family money, too.
zh: 他把旧衣服寄回家给兄弟们穿，还给家里寄了钱。

en: An old wooden box served as table.
zh: 一个旧木箱被拿来当桌子使。

en: It's no use trying to stick to the old ways.
zh: 守着老套路不放是没用的。

en: The old method proved to be best after all.

en: I was ashamed to go out in old clothes.
zh: 穿着旧衣服出门，我觉得挺不好意思的。

en: Exchange the old part for a new one.
zh: 把旧零件换成新的吧。

en: Old traditions are crumbling away.

en: Should old acquaintance be forgot, And never brought to mind?

en: An old belief is sometimes still widely current.

en: I'll discard my old jacket.

en: I ran across his telephone number in an old address book of mine.

en: I was looking at old pictures.

en: This bicycle is old, but it's better than nothing.

en: They decided to pull down the old building.

en: The old church stands north of the town.

en: As compared with the old model, this is far easier to handle.
zh: 跟旧款比起来，这个用起来容易多了。

en: Compared with the old model, this is far easier to handle.
zh: 和老款相比，这个操作起来简单得多。

en: Old homes, especially traditional Japanese ones, can be damp and unfriendly to modern life.
zh: 老房子，特别是那种传统的日式房子，住起来很潮湿，不太适应现代生活。

en: The old house was taken down.

en: The old house was demolished.

en: In many old movies the heroine is always the one to die.

en: It's an old piano.

en: The old television set went for 10 dollars.

en: An antique pot was dug out.

en: Replace the old tires with new ones.

en: Older carpets are more valuable than newer carpets.

en: There are many old Indian legends.

en: Personally, I don't think it makes any difference who wins the election.

en: Don't take it personally.

en: You shouldn't ask personal questions.

en: May I ask you a personal question?

en: It's better for you to keep out of private affairs.

en: The buying and selling of peoples' personal information is becoming a big issue.

en: Disposable income is what counts for the level of personal consumption.

en: In a country where individualism is more common, personal objections to smoking in public are usually respected.

en: The individual is the fundamental element of a community.

en: Individuals do not exist for the development of the State.

en: Each individual is different.

en: The deceased was eighty years old.

en: Private charity is only a drop in the bucket.

en: We must respect individual liberty.

en: The rights of the individual are the most important rights in a free society.

en: We must respect the will of the individual.

en: It is our policy not to give out personal information.

en: An individual has rights and responsibilities.

en: I'd like to reserve a private compartment.
zh: 我想订个包间。

en: Single or double room?

en: You get to see the wood only when it becomes too difficult to distinguish individual trees.

en: You can win all the battles yet lose the war.

en: Keep on swimming up to your limit.

en: I wonder if there is any meaning to putting proverbs into English.

en: I wonder if there is any point in translating proverbs into English.

en: Proverbs are still very popular in America.

en: As the saying goes, "Nothing ventured, nothing gained."

en: It is no use crying over spilt milk, as the proverb says.

en: Freedom of speech is now taken as a matter of course.

en: Many advantages accrue to society from the freedom of speech.

en: Freedom of speech was tightly restricted.

en: You should always be careful in your speech.

en: It is said that man is different from other animals in that man uses language.

en: Please show me the meaning of word.

en: The meaning of words can change according to their context.
zh: 词义会根据上下文而改变。

en: You had better consult a dictionary when you don't know the meaning of a word.
zh: 遇到不认识的词，你最好查查字典。

en: You should consult a dictionary when you don't know the meaning of a word.
zh: 不认识单词时，你应该查查字典。

en: Her accent gave her away.
zh: 她的口音暴露了她。

en: His accent betrays him to be a Frenchman.
zh: 他那口音一听就是法国人。

en: Try to motivate kids with verbal praise.
zh: 试着用言语赞美来激励孩子。

en: Watch your mouth!

en: He told me to be careful in speech.
zh: 他叫我说话要小心点。

zh: 简而言之，我把文字之诗定义为对美的节奏性创造。

en: Emotion counts above vocabulary in verbal communication.
zh: 在言语交流中，情感比词汇量更重要。

en: Watch out for your tongue.
zh: 说话留神点。

en: Saying is one thing, and doing is quite another.
zh: 说是一回事，做又是另一回事。

en: Words cannot convey my true feelings.
zh: 言语无法表达我真实的感受。

en: Words cannot convey my feelings.
zh: 言语无法表达我的感受。

en: I can't quite explain it, but I believe I've caught a glimpse of the differences between Japanese and American cultures and lifestyles.
zh: 我说不太清楚，但我大概看出了日美文化和生活方式的差异。

en: Words cannot express it.

en: Watch your language.

en: I am at a loss for words.

en: The words are on the tip of my tongue, but I don't quite know how to put what I want to say.
zh: 话就在嘴边，但我不知道该怎么表达我想说的话。

zh: 话就在嘴边，但我不知道该怎么说我想说的话。

en: But for language, there would be no thought.
zh: 要是没有语言，就不会有思想。

en: I could never be a true man of my word.

en: Linguistic competence is inborn, not acquired.
zh: 语言能力是天生的，不是后天习得的。

en: Ability to talk distinguishes human beings from animals.

en: Language acquisition requires creativity.

en: The linguist is quite familiar with the dialect.

en: Some consider language as a form of knowledge.
zh: 有些人认为语言是一种知识形式。

en: Some children learn languages easily and others with difficulty.
zh: 有的孩子学语言很轻松，有的却很费劲。

en: Language is one of man's most important inventions.
zh: 语言是人类最重要的发明之一。

en: Language is unique to man.

en: Language is an indispensable instrument of human society.
zh: 语言是人类社会不可或缺的工具。

en: Language is a specifically human characteristic.

en: Language is a vehicle of human thought.

en: Language is peculiar to man.

en: Language changes as human beings do.

en: Language is unique in that any statement must start out as the creation of an individual mind.

en: Language enable us to communicate with other people.

zh: 关于语言是如何起源的有各种猜测，但事实是没人真正知道。

en: You must read between the lines.

en: If you read between the lines, this letter is a request for money.
zh: 如果你看懂了言外之意，这封信其实是在要钱。

en: Please read between the lines.

en: Do as you're told to do.

en: Do it as you are told.

en: Do as you are told.

en: Silence is golden.

en: Save your breath.

en: You should keep your mouth shut.

en: Am I making myself clear?

en: Do you understand what I'm saying?

en: My lips are sealed.

en: I told you before!

en: It is difficult to put what we said in practice.

zh: 在我看来，看漫画纯粹是浪费时间。

en: To say is one thing, and to do is another.

zh: 不用说，这都怪你。

en: Obviously, the server load will increase as a result.
zh: 显而易见，服务器负载肯定会增加。

en: Needless to say, I've come here to help you.
zh: 不用说，我来这儿就是为了帮你的。

en: Needless to say, he could not get the prize.
zh: 不用说，他没拿到奖。

en: It goes without saying that every one is bound to obey the law.
zh: 众所周知，每个人都必须遵守法律。

en: Needless to say, getting up early is important.
zh: 没的说，早起肯定很重要。

en: Needless to say, fear of war has to be handed down.
zh: 不用说，对战争的恐惧是会代代相传的。

en: Needless to say, health is more important than wealth.
zh: 不用说，健康比财富更重要。

en: It goes without saying that experience is a good teacher.
zh: 不用说，经验是最好的老师。

en: It goes without saying military discipline is literally rigid.
zh: 不用说，军纪那是相当严。

en: It goes without saying that Rome was not built in a day.
zh: 不用说，罗马不是一天建成的。

en: Needless to say, he did not win the prize.
zh: 不用说，他没得奖。

en: Needless to say, health is above wealth.
zh: 不用说，健康高于财富。

en: It goes without saying that the ideology is behind the times.
zh: 不用说，这思想已经过时了。

en: Needless to say, Judy came late as usual.
zh: 不用说，朱迪又迟到了。

en: Needless to say, he never came again.
zh: 不用说，他再也没来过。

en: Needless to say, he was late for school as usual.
zh: 不用说，他又迟到了。

en: Needless to say, Norway has become the world's second largest oil supplier.
zh: 不用说，挪威已经成了世界第二大石油供应商。

en: You should be careful what you say.
zh: 你说话得注意点儿。

en: Talking is one thing, doing is another.
zh: 说是一码事，做是另一码事。

en: Saying is one thing and doing another.
zh: 说和做是两码事。

en: Saying and doing are two different things.
zh: 说和做完全是两回事。

en: To say is one thing, to do is another.
zh: 说是说，做是做。

en: Saying is quite different from doing.
zh: 说跟做差别大了去了。

en: There is no use trying to excuse yourself.
zh: 找借口也没用。

en: Don't just keep making excuses.
zh: 别老找借口了。

en: State your case briefly.
zh: 长话短说吧。

en: Settle the argument soon.
zh: 赶紧把这事儿解决了吧。

en: The quarrel left an unpleasant aftertaste.
zh: 这场争吵让人心里总觉得有点不舒服。

en: After their argument they weren't on speaking terms.
zh: 吵完架之后，他们谁也不理谁了。

en: Little remains to be said.
zh: 也没啥好说的了。

en: In other words, the field of the magnet is near the pigeon's head.
zh: 换句话说，磁场就在鸽子的头部附近。

en: She became, in other words, a good wife.
zh: 换句话说，她成了一个贤内助。

en: In other words, she became a good wife.
zh: 也就是说，她成了一个好妻子。

en: In other words, she wants to refuse the proposal.
zh: 换句话说，她想拒绝这桩婚事。

en: In other words, he is the most able young man I know.
zh: 也就是说，他是我见过的最有能力的年轻人。

en: In other words, he betrayed us.
zh: 换句话说，他出卖了我们。

en: In other words, I don't like to work with him.
zh: 也就是说，我不喜欢跟他一起干活。

en: In other words, education is the instruction of the intellect in the laws of Nature.
zh: 换句话说，教育就是传授有关自然规律的知识。

en: In order words, it is a matter of common sense.
zh: 也就是说，这就是个常识问题。

en: In other words, it takes all sorts of people to make a world.
zh: 换句话说，世界之大，什么样的人都有。

en: Haven't you gone too far?
zh: 你是不是做得有点过分了？

en: Haven't you said too much?
zh: 你是不是说得有点太多了？

en: You are going too far.
zh: 你做得太过分了。

en: Do as you were told to do.
zh: 叫你怎么做你就怎么做。

en: I felt quite relieved after I had said all I wanted to say.
zh: 把想说的话全说出来以后，我感觉轻松多了。

en: You can say whatever you want to.
zh: 你想说什么就说什么。

en: I understand what you're saying.
zh: 我明白你在说什么。

en: In other words, he is a man of faith.
zh: 也就是说，他是个有信仰的人。

en: In other words, reliability is impossible unless there is a natural warmth.
zh: 换句话说，如果没有发自内心的热情，人是靠不住的。

en: After retirement, Teresa devoted herself to caring for orphans.
zh: 退休以后，特蕾莎全身心地投入到了照顾孤儿的工作中。

en: People rarely come to see you once you are retired.
zh: 人一退休，就很少有人来看你了。

en: The natives were tormented by a long spell of dry weather.
zh: 长时间的干旱让当地人吃尽了苦头。

en: Ten o'clock local time?
zh: 当地时间十点吗？

en: I'm going to do an internship at a local company.
zh: 我要去当地的一家公司实习。

en: The natives were not allowed to enter the district.
zh: 当地人不准进入那个区域。

en: Modern civilization rests on a foundation of science and education.
zh: 现代文明是建立在科学和教育的基础上的。

en: Modern art means little to me.
zh: 我对现代艺术不太感冒。

en: Modern art has broken away from nineteenth century conventions.
zh: 现代艺术已经摆脱了19世纪的传统束缚。

en: Modern philosophy has its beginnings in the 19th century.
zh: 现代哲学起源于19世纪。

en: I have difficulty understanding abstract modern art, especially Mondrian.
zh: 我很难理解抽象的现代艺术，尤其是蒙德里安的作品。

en: Modern people cannot do without cars.
zh: 现代人离了汽车可不行。

en: Modern society is overflowing with all sorts of information.
zh: 现代社会充斥着各种各样的信息。

en: What is the role of the University in the modern society?
zh: 大学在现代社会中扮演着什么样的角色？

en: Modern poetry is often most obscure.
zh: 现代诗往往非常晦涩难懂。

en: What do you think of modern art?
zh: 你觉得现代艺术怎么样？

en: Modern science has turned many impossibilities into possibilities.
zh: 现代科学把很多不可能变成了可能。

en: It must also be said that spotting what is important in current science is a matter of judgement, one cannot know that one is right.
zh: 还得说一句，要在当下的科学中看出重点全凭个人判断，谁也没法肯定自己就是对的。

en: We often hear it said that ours is essentially a tragic age.
zh: 我们常听人说，我们这个时代本质上是个悲剧。

en: This is the age of information, and computers are playing an increasingly important role in our everyday life.
zh: 现在是信息时代，电脑在我们的日常生活中发挥着越来越重要的作用。

en: Our age goes in for quantity regardless of quality.
zh: 咱们这个时代只讲数量，不顾质量。

en: We owe our modern life to electricity.
zh: 我们的现代生活全靠有了电。

en: We live in the atomic age.
zh: 我们生活在原子时代。

en: The cultures of the world are now becoming rather similar.
zh: 现在世界各地的文化正变得越来越像。

en: Because of modern communication and transportation systems, the world is getting smaller.
zh: 因为现代通讯和交通的便利，世界变得越来越小了。

en: Modern cars differ from the early ones in many ways.
zh: 现代汽车在很多方面都和早期的不一样。

en: The social problems of the day tend to be more and more complicated.
zh: 现在的社会问题往往变得越来越复杂。

en: Modern bridges are similar in shape.
zh: 现代桥梁的形状都大同小异。
